intro: Hieracium meticeps, commonly known as the purple meadowhawk, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually purple or pink, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Hieracium meticeps is often found in open habitats and is relatively hardy, adapting well to various environmental conditions.
